channel.title: Statics on Public Interest Data::Ethics & Practice
channel.description: Recent content in Statics on Public Interest Data::Ethics & Practice

item.title: Policies
item.description: Wellbeing and Duty to Care Statement If you are feeling overwhelmed, stressed, or isolated, several individuals at Batten are ready and want to help. Both Jill Rockwell, Assistant Dean for Student Services, and Amanda Crombie, Assistant Dean for Academic Programs, are available to support all Batten Students.

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: Installing R, RStudio, and tidyverse All of our data work will be done in the open source (and free!) programming language R. You will use RStudio as the main program to access R.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Project 1: Stepping Stones Report In the first half of the semester, while we’re learning more about R, reproducible data workflows, and ethical data practices, we’ll contribute to work for the City of Charlottesville to expand and enrich a community “Stepping Stones” report, a collection of 39 metrics to gauge well-being in Charlottesville and Albemarle.

item.title: Resources
item.description: We’ll add resources here as they become relevant or we find them. Feel free to send along things you’ve found useful! Getting Started with R Instructions for installing R, RStudio, and all the tidyverse packages.

item.title: Schedule
item.description: Week Reading Materials What's Due? Jan 19 Introductions Jan 26 Data as Power, Data Wrangling Feb 2 Racialized Data, Data Wrangling Feb 9 Gendering Data, Data Wrangling and Visualization Feb 16 Relations in/to Data, Data Visualization Feb 23 Data and Harm, Data Visualization Mar 2 Communicating Data, Data Wrangling Mar 16 Data Processes, Data Wrangling Mar 23 Data Practices, Data Tables Mar 30 Countermapping, Spatial Data Apr 6 Project Peer Review, R Markdown Apr 13 Project Progress, Data Visualization Apr 20 Project Progress, Data Visualization Apr 27 Project Presentations January 19 - Introductions Introductions to class, to each other, to data feminism, to projects, and to R.

item.title: Syllabus
item.description: Overview and Goals Spring 20223 Projects Project 1: Stepping Stones Report Project 2: Multiple Equity Center Projects How We’ll Work R, RStudio Materials Getting Help and the Class Slack How We’ll Evaluate Our Work Reading Annotations, 20% Individual Data/R Assignments, 20% Collaborative Learning, 10% Project 1: Stepping Stones Report, 20% Project 2: Multiple Equity Center Projects, 30% Pre-Class Tasks Overview and Goals This course is intended to provide students experience with data science within a framework of data ethics in service of equity-oriented public policy.
